intro: Matelea hirsutissima, commonly known as the woolly matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. Matelea hirsutissima is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, thriving in arid environments.
